description: The songleader, civil rights activist and scholar died at the age of 81.
title: Bernice Johnson Reagon, a founder of The Freedom Singers and Sweet Honey in the Rock, has died

description: This is the president's second bout with the virus. He was campaigning in Las Vegas when he found out his cold symptoms were COVID.
title: Biden tests positive for COVID. It comes at an awkward time in his campaign

description: Parts of the massive Okefenokee Swamp are a wildlife refuge. Georgia is on the cusp of permitting a titanium dioxide mine next to it, prompting the federal government to invoke federal water rights.
title: U.S. Fish and Wildlife invokes federal water rights to protect huge swamp in Georgia

description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with producer Dan Collison about his documentary on the Port Chicago 50, a group of Black sailors who were charged with mutiny for refusing to work under unsafe conditions.
title: Black men exonerated after mutiny charges during WWII

description: Four days after the assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump, investigators are still trying to uncover details about security lapses and the shooter's motive.
title: Law enforcement that helped with Trump rally security is under international scrutiny

description: On Thursday night, former President Donald Trump will formally accept the republican nomination for President. What will his message be? Has that message evolved since the assassination attempt?
title: A preview of Trump's message for tomorrow's big speech

description: A former CIA analyst and prominent expert on East Asia has been arrested on federal charges. She is accused of acting as an undeclared agent of the South Korean government, a U.S. ally.
title: Former CIA analyst is arrested over ties with South Korea

description: Israeli airstrikes have hit several UNRWA schools where people are sheltering, The Gaza Health Ministry says at least 23 people, many of them women and children, were killed and more than 70 wounded.
title: Another Israeli attack hits a UN school in Gaza that was sheltering families

description: J.D. Vance will make his first speech as former President Donald Trump's running mate at the Republican National Convention on Wednesday.
title: J.D. Vance will introduce himself to voters with a primetime speech at the RNC

description: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with The Athletic's Meg Linehan about Angel City FC, the National Women’s Soccer League team, becoming the world’s most valuable women’s sports franchise.
title: Angel City FC becomes the world’s most valuable women’s sports team

description: So far the group has entertained viewers with renditions of such hits as "Life is a Highway," "All Star," "What I Like About You," "Don't Stop Believin'" and "Reelin' In The Years," among other "dad jams."
title: What to know about Sixwire, the RNC band supplying the dad rock each night during prime time

description: Researchers have found evidence of butchery marks on the back of an ancient armadillo-like animal, suggesting humans were in South America 20,000 years ago -- earlier than many researchers thought.
title: An ancient giant armadillo shows South America had humans much earlier than thought

description: In Kenya, protests that began in response to tax increases have grown into a movement demanding the president's resignation. Scores of protestors have gone missing since the anti-government protests began a month ago. Human rights groups fear that the security forces are behind these disappearances. We hear from young protestors.
title: Youth in Kenya Take to the Streets

description: Special Counsel Jack Smith is appealing a judge's order over the classified documents case against Trump, which was dismissed over his own appointment.
title: Special counsel appeals judge's dismissal of Trump documents case

description: Some of the nominations were expected — The Bear earned 23 nominations and Shogun received 25 nods. But the Television Academy still had a few surprises up its sleeve.
title: 6 takeaways from the 2024 Emmy nominations

description: After Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo took a dip in the river, she said the Olympics were "a kind of magnet that attracted all our energies towards a single date, July 26, and we did it.”
title: Paris mayor swims in the Seine to demonstrate its safety ahead of the Olympics

description: Donald Trump and J.D. Vance share a vision on the direction of an evolving Republican party. They have argued that many foreign conflicts have failed to serve U.S. interests.
title: With his choice of Vance as VP, Trump doubles down on his version of isolation

description: FRONTLINE documentarians Tom Casciato and Kathleen Hughes spent decades following two working-class families who lost well-paying manufacturing jobs and then struggled to regain their way of life.
title: Filmmakers profile America's economically lost generation in 'Two American Families'

description: At the Republican National Convention, speakers criticized President Biden's record on crime and immigration. We fact-check those claims and more. And, Eric Garner's legacy lives on 10 years later.
title: Fact-checking RNC claims on crime. And, Eric Garner's legacy lives on, 10 years later

description: Guidelines for when women should start getting mammograms have changing. A new study makes the case for explaining to women the risks and benefits of screening for breast cancer.
title: Mammograms have pros and cons for people in their 40s. Women can handle the nuance

description: At the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee Tuesday night, Republicans promised to “make America safe once again.” They say crime is up nationwide. Is it?
title: GOP vows to make America safe again. Statistics contradict their growing crime claims

description: The Global North has moved on from the mpox scare of 2022. The Global South is seeing outbreaks — and lacks the tools to address stem the virus.
title: Mpox did not fade away. Africa faces two alarming outbreaks --- and lacks vaccines

description: Temperatures were in the triple-digits in much of the area on Tuesday and authorities warn that they could top 110 degrees F in southern Spain in the coming days.
title: 'Hellishly hot' southern Europe bakes under temperatures topping 104 F

description: How do the self-described "leftist" hosts of the hit Supreme Court podcast "5-4" size up the high court's latest term? NPR speaks with the lawyers behind the irreverent show.
title: The hosts of the '5-4' podcast irreverently examine the Supreme Court's term

description: The war in Gaza is more than nine months old. Fears are growing that ongoing cross-border strikes between Israel and Iran-backed Hezbollah could escalate into all-out war in the north as well.
title: A Hezbollah spokesman tells NPR it will stop firing if fighting in Gaza ends

description: Early U.S. vice presidents focused on their constitutional role as president of the Senate, but more modern officeholders have held more influence in the White House and beyond.
title: How the vice presidency went from an 'insignificant office' to a political powerhouse

description: The official theme was crime and safety. But key speakers, including Lara Trump and Nikki Haley, described former President Donald Trump as a family man and a unifier — despite his divisive persona.
title: Women headline a night at the RNC that framed Trump as compassionate, not combative

description: NPR's Sacha Pfeiffer talks to David Wessel, director of the Hutchins Center at the Brookings Institution, about Republican vice presidential nominee J.D. Vance's approach to economic policy.
title: Examining the economic policy of J.D. Vance, Trump's vice presidential nominee

description: As Ruidoso, N.M., recovers from a deadly wildfire, victims of the state's largest fire in 2022 say FEMA still isn't giving them what they need -- despite a $4 billion appropriation from Congress.
title: Many 2022 wildfire victims in New Mexico say they've not gotten enough help from FEMA

description: A jury has found U.S. Sen. Bob Menendez of New Jersey guilty of all 16 counts of bribery, acting as a foreign agent and obstruction of justice.
title: Federal jury finds Sen. Bob Menendez guilty on all counts in bribery trial

description: In Kenya, nearly 60 people have gone missing since the anti-government protests began over a month ago. Human rights groups fear that the security forces are behind these disappearances.
title: Kenyan protesters are missing following tax hike demonstrations, rights group says

description: More than half of America’s rural hospitals lack labor and delivery services. The University of Colorado is trying to help close the gap by training nurse midwives to work in rural areas.
title: Colorado looks to midwives to solve the state's labor and delivery care shortage

description: Colorado claims to have the longest-running gay rodeo in America. The Rocky Mountain Regional Rodeo is a place to challenge hyper-masculine expectations in country and western culture.
title: The Rocky Mountain Regional Rodeo is America’s longest-running gay rodeo

description: NPR's Sacha Pfeiffer talks to David Gee of Cellebrite, a company that sells tools to law enforcement to help them access locked smartphones. The FBI is a customer.
title: What happens when law enforcement wants to break into someone's smartphone?

description: Republicans vow to "make America safe again," but the statistics contradict their claims of growing crime. Democrats who want to keep President Biden off the ballot oppose an obscure party rule.
title: Morning news brief

description: The victims had booked several rooms at the Grand Hyatt Erawan Hotel under seven names but all six were found in the same room. Police are still looking for the seventh person included in the booking.
title: 6 Americans and Vietnamese are found dead in a Bangkok hotel. Poisoning is suspected

description: The president is preparing to back term limits and an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Supreme Court justices. But these changes would require Congressional backing, and that won't be easy to get.
title: Biden is eyeing big changes for the Supreme Court. But he needs Congress to make them
